newsitem.title: TUNISIA: Tunisian refinery to process Libyan, Algerian crude.
newsitem.headline: Tunisian refinery to process Libyan, Algerian crude.

text.p: Foreign investors plan to build a $1.1 billion refinery in southern Tunisia that would process crude oil from neighbouring Algeria and Libya for the Mediterranean market, the project's director said Wednesday.
The refinery, to be build in the coastal oil terminal of La Skhira, 175 miles south of Tunis, would process six million metric tons of crude a year.
"An international tender to build the refinery would be launched at the end of the first quarter of 1997," Levon Garabette, the project's director told Reuters in the Tunisian southern city of Sfax.
"The total cost is estimated at $1.1 billion. The finance scheme is already in place, with 20 percent from equities, and 80 percent from financings," he said.
